Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior is slightly ribbed, covered with a red-slip, cream-painted decoration and very faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394207) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394207)
